gw.pl.external.entity

Class EntityFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.pl.external.entity.EntityFactory
  • Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class EntityFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory to create external entities.

      • newEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object newEntity(java.lang.String entityName)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new external entity for the given entity.
        Parameters:
        entityName - Name of the entity to create (e.g., "Person")
        Returns:
        A new external entity
        See Also:
        newEntity(Class)

      • newTempEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object newTempEntity(java.lang.Class entityType)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new external entity for the given entity type, which will not be automatically persisted. This method should be called in place of newEntity() when the resulting entity should not be automatically persisted by the Guidewire application (for example, if it is going to be passed to another plugin which will deal with persisting the information).
        Parameters:
        entityType - Interface of the external entity to create
        Returns:
        A new external entity.

      • newTempEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object newTempEntity(java.lang.String entityName)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new external entity for the given entity, which will not be automatically persisted.
        Parameters:
        entityName - Name of the external entity to create (e.g., "Person")
        Returns:
        A new external entity.
        See Also:
        newTempEntity(Class)

      • newEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object newEntity(java.lang.Object parentEntity,
                         java.lang.Class entityType)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new external entity for the given interface. The new entity will be associated with the same set of changes as the parent entity. For example, if the parent entity is committed then this new entity will be committed as well.
        Parameters:
        parentEntity - Entity with which to associate this new entity.
        entityType - Interface of the external entity to create
        Returns:
        A new external entity

      • newEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object newEntity(java.lang.Object parentEntity,
                         java.lang.String entityName)
        Deprecated. 
        Create a new external entity for the given entity. The new entity will be associated with the same set of changes as the parent entity.
        Parameters:
        parentEntity - Entity with which to associate this new entity.
        entityName - Name of the external entity to create (e.g., "Person")
        Returns:
        A new external entity
        See Also:
        newEntity(Object, Class)

      • addEntity

        public abstract java.lang.Object addEntity(java.lang.Object entity)
        Deprecated. 
        Add an existing entity to the current set of changes. For example, if you use a finder to retrieve an entity use addEntity() to add that entity to the current set of changes so that you can change values on it and then commit it.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity to add to the set of changes
        Returns:
        Entity that was added

      • getEntityByRef

        public abstract java.lang.Object getEntityByRef(java.lang.Class entityType,
                              java.lang.String publicId)
        Deprecated. 
        Get a handle to an existing entity from its Public Id.
        Parameters:
        entityType - Type of entity to find
        publicId - Public ID of the entity
        Returns:
        Entity with the given Public Id or NULL if no entity matches the Id

      • getEntityByRef

        public abstract java.lang.Object getEntityByRef(java.lang.String entityName,
                              java.lang.String publicId)
        Deprecated. 
        Get a handle to an existing entity from its Public Id.
        Parameters:
        entityName - Name of entity to find (e.g., "Person")
        publicId - Public ID of the entity
        Returns:
        Entity with the given Public Id or NULL if no entity matches the Id
        See Also:
        getEntityByRef(Class, String)

      • getEntityByRef

        public abstract java.lang.Object getEntityByRef(java.lang.Object parentEntity,
                              java.lang.Class entityType,
                              java.lang.String publicId)
        Deprecated. 
        Get a handle to an existing entity from its Public Id. The existing entity will be associated with the same set of changes as the parent entity. For example, if the parent entity is committed then any changes to this existing entity will be committed as well.
        Parameters:
        parentEntity - Entity with which to associate the existing entity.
        entityType - Type of entity to find
        publicId - Public ID of the entity
        Returns:
        Entity with the given Public Id or NULL if no entity matches the Id

      • getEntityByRef

        public abstract java.lang.Object getEntityByRef(java.lang.Object parentEntity,
                              java.lang.String entityName,
                              java.lang.String publicId)
        Deprecated. 
        Get a handle to an existing entity from its Public Id. The existing entity will be associated with the same set of changes as the parent entity.
        Parameters:
        parentEntity - Entity with which to associate the existing entity.
        entityName - Name of entity to find (e.g., "Person")
        publicId - Public ID of the entity
        Returns:
        Entity with the given Public Id or NULL if no entity matches the Id
        See Also:
        getEntityByRef(Object, Class, String)
